page.title: 01SUMMARY OF AREA
page.content: Mainly a rural area.It includes the eastern side of Canterbury which consists mainly of modern housing estates,two of which are council owned.There are several public buildings including a Hospital,three Secondary Schools and two Primary schools.The principal land uses are Orchards,especially in the south and south-east,coppice woodland and arable areas,notably cereals.Along the A257 and minor roads are many detached houses set in large spacious gardens several of which have horticultural interests.Only one minor hamlet is found in the area (Bekesbourne).Recreational land use includes a Zoo Park,a Golf Course,and a Camp Site.Several main lines of communication cross the area,including the A2 road and Cant-Dover Railway.
